metadata.notes: Enriched with dependencies and granularity analysis. Processing in progress.

T01.GK.01.description: Students identify and describe the individual steps involved in familiar classroom routines
T01.GK.01.notes: Entry point for algorithmic thinking - foundational skill

T01.GK.03.description: Students arrange picture cards to show a logical sequence

T01.GK.04.description: Students observe a simple, repeating pattern of actions and describe what happens over and over
T01.GK.04.notes: Foundation for loops; relates to T04.GK.01 (patterns)

T01.G1.01.short_name: Create step-by-step instructions for a task
T01.G1.01.description: Students create a sequence of simple, numbered steps to describe how to complete a task
T01.G1.01.notes: Synthesis of K skills - algorithm creation

T01.G1.02.short_name: Follow steps to see what happens
T01.G1.02.description: Given a short sequence of steps, students predict or trace where they end up or what object they reach

T01.G1.03.description: Students identify what step is missing or wrong in an algorithm

T01.G1.04.short_name: Compare different ways to do something
T01.G1.04.description: Students compare two different sequences of steps that accomplish the same goal

T01.G2.01.description: Students create or complete a simple algorithm that includes a branching point

T01.G2.02.description: Students create or describe an algorithm using natural language for repetition

T01.G2.03.short_name: Follow steps with choices or repeats
T01.G2.03.description: Students trace through an algorithm with branching or repetition, predicting the final outcome

T01.G2.04.short_name: Write directions to navigate a maze
T01.G2.04.description: Students create a list of turn-and-move instructions that guide a character through a grid or maze

T01.G3.01.short_name: Write a sequence of blocks in code
T01.G3.01.description: Students create a short program using block-based code where a sprite follows a sequence of steps
T01.G3.01.notes: Major milestone - unplugged to code transition

T01.G3.02.short_name: Add a choice to your algorithm
T01.G3.02.description: Students modify a script to include an if/then condition
T01.G3.02.notes: Combines unplugged conditional thinking with coding

T01.G3.03.short_name: Use a repeat block in code
T01.G3.03.description: Students create a program that uses a repeat block to execute a sequence multiple times
T01.G3.03.notes: Combines unplugged loop thinking with coding

T01.G3.04.description: Students write or speak a description of what an algorithm does after viewing code

T01.G4.01.short_name: Design a program to solve a problem
T01.G4.01.description: Students design an algorithm from scratch to solve a given problem

T01.G4.02.short_name: Improve an algorithm to use fewer steps
T01.G4.02.description: Students refactor code to reduce redundancy or improve efficiency
T01.G4.02.notes: Builds on comparison skills from G1

T01.G4.03.short_name: Use a variable to track something
T01.G4.03.description: Students create a variable and use it in their algorithm to track state

T01.G4.04.short_name: Predict what a complex program does
T01.G4.04.description: Students trace through an algorithm with sequence, branching, loops, and/or a variable
T01.G4.04.notes: Advanced version of G2.03 with variables

T01.G5.01.description: Given a flowchart or pseudocode, students translate it into block-based code

T01.G5.02.short_name: Draw or describe an algorithm plan
T01.G5.02.description: Students create a visual flowchart or write pseudocode to represent an algorithm

T01.G5.03.description: Students compare two algorithms on criteria like correctness, efficiency, and readability
T01.G5.03.notes: Advanced version of G1.04 with efficiency focus

T01.G5.04.description: Students identify and fix a logical error in an algorithm

T01.G6.01.short_name: Compare algorithm speed for different inputs
T01.G6.01.description: Students examine an algorithm's performance under different input sizes

T01.G6.02.short_name: Spot fairness problems in an algorithm
T01.G6.02.description: Students examine an algorithm and discuss how it might unfairly impact certain groups

T01.G6.03.short_name: Draw a flowchart for a complex task
T01.G6.03.description: Students create a detailed flowchart with multiple decision points and loops

T01.G6.04.description: Students implement a complex flowchart in block-based or introductory text code

T01.G7.01.description: Students recognize and apply common algorithmic patterns like search, sort, and accumulate

T01.G7.02.short_name: Choose the right algorithm for the task
T01.G7.02.description: Students justify which algorithm is most appropriate based on efficiency, clarity, or fit

T01.G7.03.description: Students write an algorithm in plain language with code-like structure

T01.G7.04.short_name: Test an algorithm on tricky inputs
T01.G7.04.description: Students test an algorithm on edge cases and identify if it fails and why

T01.G8.01.short_name: Create an algorithm to simulate a process
T01.G8.01.description: Students design an algorithm that simulates a real-world process or system

T01.G8.02.description: Students encounter the concept that some problems can be solved by breaking them into smaller versions
T01.G8.02.notes: Conceptual only - implementation is high school

T01.G8.03.description: Students examine a real-world algorithmic system and analyze its societal impacts

T01.G8.04.description: Students refactor a complex algorithm for clarity or efficiency
